messages.msgSnippet: For me the raised rim defines it as an Armorers tsuba, a Tosho tsuba would not have that attribute I think. Matt Z Recruiting Services Zurich Toren
messages.messageBody:
For me the raised rim defines it as an Armorers tsuba, a Tosho tsuba would
not have that attribute I think.

Matt

messages.subject: Re: 8 sided tsuba
messages.msgSnippet: Dear Matt and Alan Thanks for your thoughts. From looking at the tsuba books that I have I was thinking maybe katchushi (armor smiths ?) or maybe tosho (sword
messages.messageBody:
Dear Matt and Alan

Thanks for your thoughts.
From looking at the tsuba books that I have I was thinking
maybe katchushi (armor smiths ?) or maybe tosho (sword smith ?) .

But how can you tell? I have read the section in Nihon to Koza
translated by Harry Watson.

If anyone else has any thoughts please let me know.

I am on digest mode so will be slow in answering.

Thanks again.

later
david

>
>Message: 1
> Date: Sun, 2 May 2004 15:25:09 +0200
> From: "Matthew E. Hoyle" <matthewhoyle@...>

>Ok, big mouth time again. Going on the way the mimi has been shaped and how
>the metal has been worked, I would say ko katchushi school. Probably
>produced in the Lateish Muromachi period, 16th century.
>
>The hitsu ana look like they were probably cut at a later stage. I know the
>square one should be telling me something, but I can't for the life of me
>think what??
>
>Well I've put my manhood on the line now........ hahahaha. So did I screw up
>or not?
>
>Matt

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] 8 sided tsuba
messages.msgSnippet: Ok, big mouth time again. Going on the way the mimi has been shaped and how the metal has been worked, I would say ko katchushi school. Probably produced in
messages.messageBody:
Ok, big mouth time again. Going on the way the mimi has been shaped and how
the metal has been worked, I would say ko katchushi school. Probably
produced in the Lateish Muromachi period, 16th century.

The hitsu ana look like they were probably cut at a later stage. I know the
square one should be telling me something, but I can't for the life of me
think what??

Well I've put my manhood on the line now........ hahahaha. So did I screw up
or not?

Matt
